top10_tweets_like:
A short thread of #rstats resources I have made freely available online! First off, an introductory textbook on statistics with R pitched at beginners focusing on base R rather than tidyverse tools. 

https://t.co/gQPX26lRrB

Reminder: there are hundreds of great, FREE learning resources for #rstats out there. 

There's no need to sign up to take courses with a disgusting, ethically bankrupt company with sniveling, feckless leadership.

This is your periodic reminder of free #rstats learning content that we‚Äôve produced largely in response to the DataCamp incident. 

I want my students to feel valued and safe. 

First off: The R-Bootcamp. No install required, just browser: https://t.co/Ao1MeyqErv
My first package on CRAN. I can't wait to see what cool #rstats packages people will build using CGAL headers #rspatial https://t.co/tfpXSyZxpi

Announcing the launch of my #rstats pelotonR package!! 

The package offers simple access to #peloton data through R.  Including joined metadata, paged data & more!  Check out the tutorial below for "how to's", sample code and #dataviz examples!

https://t.co/6laPqujOq0 https://t.co/lZuOqQ4mYt

Just posted a @StackOverflow answer you might find useful: how to use `sf::st_filter()` to do spatial overlay within an #rstats/#rspatial pipeline.  Example here is extracting Census tracts within a given US metro area https://t.co/G3pKmAFfZP https://t.co/H5hH31wXHg
It says a lot about the #rstats community that, despite yet more badness involving DataCamp (*massive eyeroll*), they continue to generate and share free resources for learning R:
